Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Esculentin-1ARb (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals: ZZHa_t; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: the crawfish frog,Rana areolata, North America

Literature Information.Literature: This peptide could inhibit HIV infection at a concentration that is also toxic to T cells (J Virol 2005; 79:11598-11606).Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 3 uM) and S. aureus (MIC 60 uM), but not C.albicans (MIC >200 uM).Toxicity:  not hemo.lytic HC50=120 uM. Updated 5/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Ali MF, Lips KR, Knoop FC, Fritzsch B, Miller C, Conlon JM.2002
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides and protease inhibitors in the skin secretions of the crawfish frog, Rana areolata.
